questions.q: What is the computer security triad?

a.option: A set of three basic principles to protect information: Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability.
A type of antivirus software that protects against three specific types of malware.
An authentication method that uses three factors to verify the user's identity.
A way to control access to computing resources through three levels of permissions.

questions.q: What does it mean for information to be confidential?

a.option: That only authorized people can access it.
Make it accurate and complete.
Make it available for use when necessary.
That it is protected against malware and other threats.

questions.q: What measures can be taken to ensure the integrity of the information?

a.option: Use digital signatures to verify the authenticity of data.
Make regular backup copies of information.
Implement security policies to control access to information.
All of the above.

a.option: That the information is accessible for use when necessary.
That the information is confidential and cannot be accessed by unauthorized persons.
That the information is accurate and complete.
That the information is protected against malware and other threats.
